notes.title: Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR)
notes.content:
CSR is a self-regulating business model that helps a company be socially accountable to itself, its stakeholders, and the public. Key aspects include:

• Environmental responsibility
• Ethical responsibility
• Philanthropic responsibility
• Economic responsibility

notes.title: Stakeholder Theory
notes.content:
The stakeholder theory suggests that companies should create value for all stakeholders, not just shareholders. Primary stakeholders include:

• Shareholders
• Employees
• Customers
• Suppliers
• Community
• Environment

notes.title: Corporate Governance Models
notes.content:
Different countries follow different corporate governance models:

1. Anglo-American Model - Shareholder primacy
2. German Model - Stakeholder approach
3. Japanese Model - Relationship-based
4. Family Business Model - Concentrated ownership
